docs.snippet: THE Department of State recently notified the Pan American Union that the United States is ready to sign the Inter-American Treaty on the Roerich pact, which seeks to preserve works of art and science from the destruction of war.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Department of State recently notified the Pan American Union that the United States is ready to sign the Inter-American Treaty on the Roerich pact, which seeks to preserve works of art and science from the destruction of war.

headline.main: SO. AMERICAN CREDIT OFF.; Collections Continue Favorable, However, Bureau Reports.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Oct. 27. -- The seasonal decline in note circulation of the Bank of England continued this week, the decrease being u2,500,000. Total circulation now stands at u374,700,000, which is, however, u5,500,000 higher than a year ago, and can be...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 27. -- The seasonal decline in note circulation of the Bank of England continued this week, the decrease being u2,500,000. Total circulation now stands at u374,700,000, which is, however, u5,500,000 higher than a year ago, and can be accounted for by more active trade.

headline.main: BANK OF ENGLAND CUTS CIRCULATION; Seasonal Decline of u2,500,000 Leaves Total Still Above That of Last Year.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Chase National Bank, as special agent for City of San Paulo (Brazil) 6 per cent external secured sinking fund bonds of 1919, due in 1943, reported yesterday that under a decree by the Federal Government of Brazil it had received funds with which...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Chase National Bank, as special agent for City of San Paulo (Brazil) 6 per cent external secured sinking fund bonds of 1919, due in 1943, reported yesterday that under a decree by the Federal Government of Brazil it had received funds with which to pay 17 1/2 per cent of the face value of coupons due today, or $5.25 for each $30 coupon.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2. -- A generally spotty tone prevailed in Latin-American trade during October, with factors in individual countries too variable to appraise as a whole, the Department of Commerce revealed today in its weekly survey of business...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2. -- A generally spotty tone prevailed in Latin-American trade during October, with factors in individual countries too variable to appraise as a whole, the Department of Commerce revealed today in its weekly survey of business conditions abroad.

headline.main: BUSINESS IN MEXICO SUFFERS SETBACK; Trade Conditions in Other Latin-American Countries Are Spotty With Check in Cuba. BELGIAN GAINS LIMITED Recent Improvements Also Are Unsatisfactory in Holland -- Australian Trend Still Upward.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 27. -- The government has submitted to Congress a plan for suburban colonization which is similar in several respects to the New Deal homestead projects in the United States. It includes the selling of small plots to city workers...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 27. -- The government has submitted to Congress a plan for suburban colonization which is similar in several respects to the New Deal homestead projects in the United States. It includes the selling of small plots to city workers so that they may grow a portion of their foodstuffs on their own land.

headline.main: ARGENTINA FAVORS HOMESTEAD PLAN; Congress to Consider Project for Colonization Similar to Our Own. SEVERAL CLASSES BENEFIT Farming Folk Living Abroad Will Be Welcomed as Well as Native Unemployed.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Special Correspondence, THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Prices were firm and dealings were at the usual slow Saturday pace in yesterday's bond trading on the New York Stock Exchange United States Government securities and high-grade domestic corporation issues were generally higher, while speculative...
docs.lead_paragraph: Prices were firm and dealings were at the usual slow Saturday pace in yesterday's bond trading on the New York Stock Exchange United States Government securities and high-grade domestic corporation issues were generally higher, while speculative bonds were irregular.

headline.main: BOND PRICES FIRM IN LIGHT TRADING; Federal and Corporation Loans Advance -- Speculative Issues Are Irregular. UTILITIES POINT HIGHER Domestic Average Declines 25c and Foreign Rises 15c in Week's Records.
